analyzed: tshe 'di'i spyod yul la ma chags pa'i 'du shes dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje dang / byams pa'i 'du shes dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa thams cad yongs su 'dor zhing spong ba'i 'du shes dang / tshul khrims 'chal cing nyams pa thams cad bshags shing /
translated: the perception of not being attached to the objects of experience in this life, the perception of compassion and love for all sentient beings, the perception of completely abandoning and rejecting all grudges, the perception of confessing all one’s own and others’ broken and degenerate ethics,

original: tshul khrims thams cad yang dag par blang ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag dang / gzhan gyis nyes pa chen po byas pa @241b dag la yang ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag dang gzhan gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du byas pa dag la 'bras bu dang /

translated: the perception of taking up all ethics, the perception of lightness with regard to the great faults committed by oneself and others, the perception of the great fruits and benefits of the small roots of virtue created by oneself and others,

translated: the perception of not being afraid or terrified of the other side of the world, the perception of impermanence with regard to all compounded phenomena, the perception of the absence of self in all phenomena,
